The sea creatures that live in the ocean would have to adapt to living in freshwater, which could lead to new species of fish and other aquatic animals.
The tides would no longer exist as the gravitational pull of the moon and sun would not be strong enough to cause the high and low tides.
The ocean floor would become exposed, revealing the secrets of the deep sea and potentially opening up new areas for exploration and mining.
The salt content of the ocean would slowly be removed by plants and other organisms, leading to a gradual shift in the pH levels of the water.
The ocean currents that help regulate the global climate would be disrupted, leading to extreme weather events and changes in ocean temperatures.
